Label: SC_SHORT_CODE
Comment: "As per official numbering plan, 85xxx shortcodes are shared cost numbers. As the cost\ndetails are not clear, categorized them as unknown cost numbers."

Label: XML_FIXED_LINE
Comment: "Some ranges were previously described as ""universal"", but in subsequent versions of the\nITU doc they have been specified to be mobile or fixed-line. We follow the ITU\ndesignations, even though some publications still refer to them as universal."

Label: XML_FIXED_LINE
Comment: "According to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_numbers_in_Bahrain, the ranges\n""6966-6969, 6996, 6999"" are assigned to Rapid. However this contradicts the ITU doc\nwhich lists ""6966, 6969, 6996, 6999"". We follow ITU here."

Label: XML_MOBILE
Comment: "31 is assigned to Royal Court, as per documents on Bahrain's own telecom site, even\nthough it is omitted from the ITU document. Based on online evidences added prefix\n354 to mobile."

Label: XML_PREMIUM_RATE
Comment: "87 numbers are ""wholly paid by the caller"", so they are slotted under premium-rate for\nnow."
